A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. He suffered minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera, previously enforcing a 30mph speed limit in Handsworth, Birmingham, has not been working for over two years. It was turned off along with around 300 other speed and traffic cameras in March 2013 due to obsolete technology. The camera is now pointing at a house in Wellington Road, and a council engineer will visit the site to potentially remove it. The council is developing a pilot using digital technology for a limited number of sites, but there are no plans to include the Wellington Road camera in this pilot. The owners of the house were not available for comment.

Usain Bolt, the six-time Olympic gold medallist, will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt expressed his excitement and readiness to run, citing Jamaica's successful tradition in relays and his desire to make the country proud. The full Jamaican team list for the competition will be announced soon.

In the passage, Barcelona players Neymar and Dani Alves supported the club's basketball side, watching El Clasico against Real Madrid. Neymar's sister, Rafaella, accompanied them. Barcelona won the match 85-80. Neymar also led Brazil to a 1-0 win over Chile. Before the international break, Barcelona won their El Clasico match, moving four points clear at the top of La Liga. Neymar and his teammates will face Celta Vigo in La Liga, aiming for a treble of trophies. Real Madrid remains atop the Euro League division.

Italy is facing a surge in migrants from Africa and the Middle East, with over 8,000 rescued from boats in distress between Friday and Monday. A spokesman for Save the Children fears 400 migrants may be missing after a ship carrying 550 people capsized in the Mediterranean Sea, but the Italian coast guard has not found any evidence of the incident. The International Organization for Migration reports that over 10,000 migrants have arrived in Italy this year, with most coming from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit point. At least 480 migrants have died this year due to bad weather and overcrowded vessels, often with captains and crews abandoning ships.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is delighted that Alexis Sanchez chose to join the club over Liverpool. Sanchez, a Chilean forward, has made an instant impact in English football, scoring 19 goals so far this season. Wenger believes Sanchez's quick adaptation to the new environment proves he is one of the best players around. Wenger also downplayed any talk of a potential summer transfer move for Liverpool forward Raheem Sterling. He praised Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers for developing his team following the sale of Suarez and injury to striker Daniel Sturridge.

Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, will attempt to break the cycling hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. The record is currently held by Australian Rohan Dennis, who achieved 52.491km in an hour. Wiggins, who will turn 35 on April 28, aims to add this accomplishment to his list of achievements. He will ride at the Lee Valley VeloPark and hopes for a capacity crowd of 6,000 spectators. The event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports. Wiggins will also participate in the inaugural Tour de Yorkshire for his eponymous team before preparing for the Hour. He is targeting a British record eighth Olympic medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics in the four-man, four-kilometre team pursuit. The current Hour record is 52.491km, set by A

Serena Williams, the twice French Open champion, struggled but won against Sara Errani in the Fed Cup play-off on Sunday. Despite her victory, she admitted she was not fully prepared for the claycourt season. The US team was defeated 3-2, and Williams and Alison Riske lost their doubles match, leading to their relegation to World Group II. Williams, 33, has won 19 grand slam singles titles, including the Australian Open, but her French Open record is her least successful among the four Grand Slam tournaments. The US team's captain, Mary Joe Fernandez, emphasized the need for harder work to improve their performance and return to the elite nations in the next year.

River Plate, an Argentine football club, is interested in signing Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao, who spent eight years with them before joining Porto in 2009. Falcao has been on loan at Manchester United but has struggled to score goals, with only four Premier League goals in the current season. His future with Manchester United is uncertain, as they may exercise their option to keep him or if he returns to his parent club, Monaco. Despite his struggles at Manchester United, Falcao has been in good form for his country, Colombia, scoring three goals in two games, equaling the country's all-time goalscoring record with 24 goals. Falcao joined River Plate at 15 and scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for them during his four seasons in the first team.

Ella Henderson, a 19-year-old X Factor finalist and pop star, has been announced as the official face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. This is her first brand collaboration. The campaign features Henderson with her long hair styled in various ways, including wavy and a tousled half-ponytail. The partnership between Henderson and Batiste was facilitated by the MILES agency. The campaign launched with a TV advertising campaign featuring Henderson's latest single, Mirror Man. Henderson is excited about the collaboration as she uses dry shampoo regularly.

Aaron Siler, 26, was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres on March 14 after being confronted and armed with a weapon. Torres is on leave and a billboard paid for by the Kenosha Professional Police Association features a photograph of Torres and his dog, thanking the community for its support. Siler's family and friends have criticized the billboard as disrespectful, while the police association claims no offense was intended. The shooting came 10 days after Torres shot and wounded Terry Knight, who was charged with second-degree recklessly endangering safety. Kenosha police asked the state Division of Criminal Investigation to investigate both shootings, with the investigation into Siler's death continuing.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. The militants, identified as members of the Sunni Muslim group Jaish al Adal, crossed into Iran from Pakistan. Jaish al Adal is an anti-Iranian group that has targeted Shiites and aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan. Iranian authorities have asked Pakistani authorities to catch the surviving assailants. Pakistan has condemned the attack as an "act of terrorism" and has stated that they will apprehend and bring to justice any militants who entered Pakistan after the attack.

The classic video game "Space Invaders" was developed in Japan in the late 1970s, and its real-life counterparts are now the subject of a political discussion in Japan. The country's Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object (UFO), according to Defense Minister Gen Nakatani. When the ASDF detects potential UFOs, they make visual observations and sometimes find birds or other aircraft, but no extraterrestrial objects. Antonio Inoki, a flamboyant former wrestler-turned-lawmaker, asked about UFOs during a parliamentary meeting, and Nakatani responded that no UFOs from outer space have been detected. Inoki has made several notable appearances in the U.S.-based WWE and Japan's Upper House for politics, and has promoted various products and attempted "basketball diplomacy" in North Korea. He also claims to have seen a UFO but is unsure if aliens exist. This is not the first time Japanese politicians have discussed

A passenger, Jin Pai, 35, was hospitalized with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after attempting to avoid sitting on a toilet in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport. He was standing on the rim of the toilet, which then collapsed and shattered on the floor, causing his injuries. Pai was found bleeding and telephoned his companions for help. He was later taken to a Hefei hospital, where he received several dozens of stitches. Pai initially confessed to squatting on the toilet but later changed his story to the police, claiming he was sitting when the toilet gave way. Authorities believe the incident was an accident.

Kevin Rebbie, a 56-year-old man from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested and charged with multiple counts of aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy. The charges stem from a 15-year-old girl discovering a hidden camera in her bathroom, which was traced back to Rebbie. The investigation revealed that Rebbie had been sexually abusing the girl for four years, filming her and others with the camera. The footage, which included close-up images of children's genitalia, was uploaded to Rebbie's computer. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including the now-15-year-old girl, specifically to record her undressing and showering. The girl's family relationship with Rebbie is unknown. Rebbie's preliminary hearing is on May 1, and he is being held on a $500,000 bail.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's latest book series features fathers leaping into the air while their daughters look directly into the camera and smile. The images, titled "Daughter and Salaryman," show fathers in sharp suits making energetic poses, often with pained expressions. The daughters are dressed casually, and the family poses in front of various Japanese landmarks. The series allows fathers to express their fun side and is already gaining online interest.

Kevin Pietersen, a former England batsman, has been rejoined by Surrey county team as he aims to force his way back into the England Test set-up. Pietersen was dismissed as England's managing director, but his dismissal has allowed him to focus on the start of the county championship season. He looked in deep thought during a team photo shoot at the KIA Oval, but was also in a jovial mood as his potential return to the international set-up took a step closer. Pietersen last featured at international level during the last Ashes tour in Australia last year, which ended in a disastrous series defeat for England. Surrey will begin their county championship campaign at Glamorgan on April 19.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, a relegation-threatened Romanian club, sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. Ze Maria was reinstated the previous day after owner Angelo Massone decided to give the coaching staff another chance. However, the coach's flamboyant owner was once again disappointed, leading to his dismissal after a 2-0 loss to mid-table FC Botosani. The result left Ceahlaul 16th in the standings, six points adrift of safety. Ze Maria, a former Brazil defender who played 25 times for the national team, replaced Florin Marin in January and will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Nabil Dirar, Radamel Falcao's former Monaco teammate, believes Falcao regrets his failed loan move to Manchester United. Falcao struggled to reach his previous heights at United, scoring only four goals all season. Despite United's unwillingness to make Falcao's transfer permanent, Dirar thinks Falcao would have been better off staying at Monaco, where he could have participated in the Champions League and potentially thrived in a more vibrant atmosphere.

A man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask, described as very tall, robbed a dairy in Christchurch, New Zealand on Saturday. He made off with the dairy's till and about $1500 in cash. The robbery occurred around 12:30 PM at the Union St dairy in east Christchurch. The offender was last seen wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt and an oversized mask. The dairy owner's daughter was the victim, and she ran out of the shop screaming 'robber!' when the masked man demanded cash. The robbery was unusual as it involved a till drawer and a significant amount of money, unlike typical robberies in the area. Police are appealing for information to help identify the robber, who is still at large.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was arrested on Monday for allegedly having sex with a 15-year-old student on consecutive nights in January. She was initially arrested on March 19 for having an inappropriate relationship with another 15-year-old student. Granado admitted to kissing the first boy and allowing him to touch her breasts in April 2018. She was suspended and put on administrative leave. The second set of charges involves a second boy, also 15, who allegedly accused Granado of having a sexual relationship with her on the same nights as the first boy. Granado was arrested again and booked into Irving County Jail, released after posting a $50,000 bail. The school district has stated that they took immediate and appropriate action and Granado is on administrative leave, preventing her from working with students and being present on any Irving ISD property.

A video of a large crocodile in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, swimming through a marina with a dead pet dog in its jaws has been viewed over 500,000 times. The incident occurred when the dog, belonging to a local bike shop owner, ventured too close to the crocodile. The crocodile held the dog in its mouth for a long time before releasing it. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta due to the area's mangrove forests and golf courses. The video has sparked horror and fear among social media users, who have reacted to the sight of the crocodile.

Steve Bruce, manager of Hull City, is confident they can avoid relegation from the Barclays Premier League despite a poor start to the season. They have won only six out of 24 games, targeting 10 wins to stay up. Hull were beaten 2-0 by Southampton, leaving them just two points clear of the drop zone. Bruce attributes their struggles to several long-term injuries to key players. Southampton moved up to fifth in the table after a 1-0 win against Hull, with James Ward-Prowse scoring the winning penalty. Ronald Koeman had to intervene when Sadio Mane tried to take the penalty, reminding his team about team rules.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, was banned from the classroom for at least two years and ordered to pay £100 in costs after he allowed pupils to change their SATs exam answers, which invalidated the school's entire SATs results for the year. Guffick also altered some of the pupils' exam answers himself before the papers were sent off. The Department for Education annulled the school's SATs results due to the suspected breach of exam rules. Guffick admitted the allegations and accepted it amounted to unacceptable professional conduct. The panel found that no changes of any kind should be made to exam scripts outside test conditions. Guffick was given 28 days to appeal against the decision to the High Court.

Anders Lindegaard, Manchester United goalkeeper, tied the knot with Swedish model Misse Beqiri in a beach wedding in Mauritius last year. They have a son together and have been dating since 2012. Lindegaard has struggled for playing time at Manchester United, making just 19 league appearances in five seasons. He is currently third-choice goalkeeper at the club. Despite his struggles on the pitch, Lindegaard and Beqiri enjoyed a day off together in Cheshire, England, with Lindegaard posting a picture of them on Instagram. Beqiri is a model with over 17,000 followers on Instagram and regularly posts modelling photos. Lindegaard has been linked with a move to FC Midtjylland but the two clubs could not agree on a price.

The 13 glowing blue letters that once lit up Yankee Stadium, installed in 1976 and taken down in 2008, failed to find a buyer at an auction at Sotheby's. The letters, which were expected to bring in $300,000 to $600,000, received no bids, with the only person who raised a paddle being a Sotheby's employee. The current owner of the signage is Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased them for an undisclosed amount after the stadium's final game in 2008. Jackson had bought the letters on a lark and joked that he might have gotten ahead of himself once he saw their size. The Yankee Stadium bullpen car from the late 60s, which was estimated at $20,000 to $30,000, sold for $112,500 at auction.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities after they were photographed smoking shisha. Sterling, who will lead Liverpool's line at Wembley, was also seen inhaling nitrous oxide. Rodgers didn't discipline them but urged them to learn from the incident. He emphasized the importance of professionalism and responsibilities for elite sportspersons. Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa, but Rodgers hasn't revealed if he'll recall him. Liverpool fell short in the title race and Capital One Cup last season, but Rodgers believes they are ready to progress in the FA Cup.

Mesut Ozil, Arsenal's playmaker, enjoyed his home comforts in London after the international break, posting a picture of himself with his dog. He impressed in Germany's 2-0 win over Georgia, scoring three goals since returning from injury. Ozil has been doing well in English football, with four assists in his last four games. He missed Arsenal's last game due to illness but is expected to start against Liverpool. Ozil has been spotted in a Berlin nightclub after missing Arsenal's 2-1 win at St James' Park, but manager Arsene Wenger denied the claims. Ozil prefers playing in many matches and feels he fits in 'perfectly' with English football.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu has confirmed that the La Liga leaders have no plans to replace Luis Enrique, who has been impressing with his performance since taking charge last summer. Enrique is only six games away from winning the title, and Bartomeu is satisfied with his work. Despite previous speculation about a potential replacement in the summer, Bartomeu has refuted these claims. Enrique's side recently defeated Valencia, with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson, Liverpool's vice-captain, has agreed to a new long-term contract worth around £100,000-a-week, set to run until the summer of 2020. This comes after his current contract had 14 months left and his advisors had been in talks with the club since the beginning of the season. Henderson, who was signed by Kenny Dalglish in 2011, has been a key player under Brendan Rodgers and has been considered for the role of club captain. His form this season has been excellent, with 13 assists and 7 goals from midfield. The club is keen to tie Henderson down with up to 10 players set to leave.

Filipe Luis, a Chelsea player, is content with his current contract and wants to stay at the club until its end. Despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him, Luis is happy at Chelsea. He played for Brazil during the international break but is now focused on the Premier League title run-in. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is ensuring the team remains focused and concentrated, despite having nine challenging games left in the season.

Nathan Hughes, a Wasps No 8, had his three-match ban for accidentally knocking out George North overturned on appeal. He was initially sent off and banned for reckless behavior after his knee collided with North's head during a Northampton match, leaving North unconscious. Hughes was criticized for the incident, but many, including Wasps' captain James Haskell and former England player Austin Healey, argued that the ban was too harsh as there was no intent and the accident's outcome should not determine the punishment. The appeal panel agreed, concluding that the incident occurred accidentally and no act of foul play took place. Hughes is now free to return to action but is not in the match-day squad for Wasps' upcoming Aviva Premiership fixture.

The passage describes a series of wildfires in southeastern Siberia, started by farmers for field clearing. These fires, which started on April 14, quickly spread due to strong winds, destroying dozens of villages. The smoke from these fires was carried across the Pacific Ocean, resulting in a series of fiery sunsets in the Pacific Northwest, including parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. The intense red sunsets are due to smoke particles filtering out shorter wavelength colors, allowing red and orange to penetrate the air unfiltered. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve and the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig, a Missouri mom, had her brand new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway on Monday night. The car was found four days later by Mick Sexton, who returned it to her with new red rims and detailing. Schoenig, instead of getting upset, thanked the thieves for "pimping out" her vehicle on Facebook. However, she is now getting the car professionally cleaned due to a strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana. She is also creating a smoothie at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, to honor Sexton, featuring banana, pineapple, peach, and coconut cream. Sexton is described as a very special person who is vibrant, happy, and loves making people laugh.

Manchester City players, including Sergio Aguero and David Silva, will lose £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. This is due to their incentivized contracts to stay within financial fairplay requirements. The team is currently in fourth place, four points behind Liverpool, and needs to win the qualifying round to secure their spot. The top three teams automatically qualify for the Champions League, while the fourth-place team must compete in a qualifying round. The total bonus pool for the squad is around £12 million, with players like Aguero and Yaya Toure potentially missing out on significant paydays if they don't reach the top four. Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has admitted that the team has struggled in the last three months and needs to improve to sign top-class players like Paul Pogba.

Manchester United's Under 18s won a'mini-derby' match against City with a score of 1-0, thanks to a delightful free-kick by Callum Gribbin. The match was played at Altrincham's stadium, with a crowd of around 1,000, due to free entry. The United team, composed mainly of English players, lined up in a 3-4-3 formation. City's closest player to scoring was Marcus Wood with an audacious chip. United's Callum Gribbin also showed impressive skills, scoring the winning goal with a free-kick. The result leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand, while City has lost both matches in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart, an England and Manchester City goalkeeper, praised fellow goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon as a 'legend of the game' after Buffon earned his 147th cap. Hart, who received his 50th cap against Italy, expressed admiration for Buffon's skill and dedication to the game at the age of 37. Hart aims to continue learning and improving in his career, while also celebrating Buffon's achievement.

Chipotle, a Mexican restaurant chain, is entering the $70 billion food delivery market by partnering with Postmates, an app that hires independent contractors for food delivery. This service will be available in 67 cities, with a 9% service charge and delivery fees starting at $5. Chipotle has previously turned down third-party delivery services but has now given Postmates the green light. Other franchises, such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King, are also planning to offer delivery services. Chipotle has gained popularity with political figures, including Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton, who have been spotted dining at Chipotle outlets.

The parents of Martin Richard, one of the victims of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing, have written a op-ed in The Boston Globe urging the Justice Department to drop the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the other suspect involved in the bombing. They have lived through the trauma of their son's death and their daughter's injuries, and have witnessed the graphic evidence presented in court. They understand the heinousness of the crimes committed but are in favor of Tsarnaev spending the rest of his life in prison without the possibility of release, and waiving all appeal rights. They believe that pursuing the death penalty could prolong the pain and bring years of appeals, which is not in the best interest of their remaining children.

The passage describes a luxury home built inside a custom-built Boeing 747-8, costing £400million. The plane, initially designed for 600 passengers, has been converted for a single ultra-wealthy owner. It features a large dining room, lounge,'state room', 'aeroloft' with eight full beds, conference room, office/guest bedroom, main suite, dining room with a kitchen, and a hotel-like ambience. The plane is one of the most luxurious private planes ever built, with the layout published by Greenpoint Technologies.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying an uncrewed Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station. However, the attempt to land the rocket's second stage on a drone ship was unsuccessful, with the rocket tipping over. SpaceX aims to reduce space access costs by reusing rockets, similar to airplanes. The Dragon spacecraft will deliver supplies, research equipment, and an espresso maker to the space station, where it will be unpacked and filled with experiments before returning to Earth. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the ISS, and Tuesday's launch was the second attempt for this mission.

Priscilla Presley, Elvis Presley's former wife, will serve as a witness at the first wedding to be held at a new chapel dedicated to the singer's legacy in Las Vegas. The chapel, located inside the Westgate Hotel, is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit of Elvis' artifacts. An Elvis-obsessed couple will have the opportunity to win the 'ultimate wedding' by submitting a video or photos along with an explanation, and the winning couple will get married in the chapel with Priscilla Presley in attendance. The chapel will also offer a free wedding reception, hotel suite for two nights, and airfares and concert tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. Priscilla Presley emphasized that this is not a joke and that impersonators are not allowed.

Liverpool's Jordan Henderson believes they can catch Manchester City in the Barclays Premier League. Henderson and Simon Mignolet played their 47th game of the season in Liverpool's 2-0 win over Newcastle, equaling the record for appearances by any player in the top five European leagues. After poor results against Manchester United and Arsenal, Liverpool found winning form and are now four points behind City. Henderson emphasized the importance of winning games and putting in performances to catch City. Raheem Sterling and Joe Allen scored for Liverpool, with Allen capitalizing on a defensive mistake in the second half. Newcastle had a penalty claim, but Allen admitted it was a close call. Liverpool secured another vital win in the Premier League battle.

Roma ended their four-month winless streak at home with a 1-0 victory over Napoli in Serie A. Miralem Pjanic scored the winning goal in the 25th minute, and goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several crucial saves to secure the win. This victory moved Roma provisionally four points ahead of Lazio in the Champions League race. Napoli's winless streak extended to five matches, and they remained fifth in the league. The match was played under tight security due to a fan's death before last season's Italian Cup final involving the two teams. Roma was without injured captain Francesco Totti and fellow forward Gervinho, but Pjanic quickly made an impact with a free kick and a goal. De Sanctis praised the victory as a way to gain continuity and fill the team with pride.

Doncaster Rovers' League One match against Fleetwood Town ended in a 0-0 draw, which was not exciting for fans. The match highlights were only 27 seconds long, showing the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle. The managers from both teams were present on the touchline during the match.

The passage describes a man named Roland Giroux who has a unique relationship with his blood parrot cichlid fish. Despite the fish's marine nature, Giroux interacts with it through touch, even dipping his hand into the tank to give it strokes and massages. The fish initially moves away but eventually becomes relaxed and responsive to Giroux's touch. The fish swims in circles, circles around Giroux's fingers, and even swims up his arm. Giroux had to remove two other fish from the tank due to bullying, and the blood parrot cichlid became more sociable and enjoyed being stroked. Giroux spends at least 15 minutes each day massaging and playing with his fish. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid of the midas and redhead cichlid, first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

Ben Stokes, a fiery character in the England cricket team, had a heated clash with Marlon Samuels during the second Test between West Indies and England. He was later talked to by England coach Peter Moores, who advised him to control his aggression. Stokes has a reputation for being feisty and fiery, but England want to harness this energy to bring runs and wickets to the team. They plan to play both Adil Rashid and Ben Stokes in the upcoming matches, but there is no need for two spinners, so they aim to develop these exciting players for the international game.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12 at the Cardiff City Stadium is a sell-out with 33,000 tickets sold. Wales, led by coach Chris Coleman, is in a strong position to qualify for the tournament since the 1958 World Cup. Belgium, ranked fourth in the world, leads the group with Wales close behind. The match is expected to be highly anticipated, with Wales' impressive performance in Israel raising expectations. The FAW has reported a surge in ticket orders, leading to the sell-out of general admission tickets. Wales prefers playing at the Cardiff City Stadium due to its intimate atmosphere.

England's Under-17 squad for the UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria includes talented players from Premier League clubs like Chelsea, Arsenal, and Liverpool. The team, led by coach John Peacock, is the defending champion and has been placed in Group D with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. They will start their campaign against Italy in Burgas on May 7. Notable inclusions are Chelsea's Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo, as well as Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold, who have been recalled after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers. Arsenal's Chris Willock has also been called up for the first time. Their remaining matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.

Manchester City is interested in signing 14-year-old Belgian footballer Evangelos Patoulidis from Anderlecht. Patoulidis is considered one of the best talents in Anderlecht's youth system and has also attracted interest from Arsenal and Barcelona. He previously turned down a move to Barcelona's academy due to his family's desire for him to continue his studies. Manchester City is in talks with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock to agree on a compensation package for the player. Manuel Pellegrini, Manchester City's manager, is looking to sign promising young talents like Patoulidis for the future.

A 33-year-old transgender escort, Vanessa Santillan, was found dead in a £400,000 flat in Fulham, south west London, at the end of March. She died from injuries to the head and neck. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but has been bailed. Scotland Yard is appealing for anyone who had contact with Santillan in the hours before her death to come forward. Detective Chief Inspector Rebecca Reeves, leading the investigation, urged anyone who saw Santillan on Friday or Saturday to come forward. Santillan had been working as a transgender escort and had moved to London from Mexico. She had been talking of her love for London on social media in the weeks before her death.

A woman named Dawn, who has suffered seven miscarriages, had saved £207 for a £500 grave stone for her deceased son, Daniel James. Her friend and housemate, Jamie, who is a convicted burglar, stole the money. Dawn confronted Jamie and his girlfriend Carol, but they initially denied knowing anything about the missing money. Dawn then asked the Jeremy Kyle show to conduct a lie detector test, which revealed that Jamie had taken the money. Dawn was devastated and felt betrayed by Jamie's actions. She had to bury one of her miscarriages and was planning to use the money for Daniel James' grave stone, but Jamie stole the money and used it for himself. Dawn was comforted by her partner, also named Jamie, after the show.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidi captives, mostly women and children, after coordinating with Arab tribal leaders. The Yazidis, a Kurdish minority, were targeted by ISIS due to their religious beliefs and have suffered persecution for years. The release comes after ISIS' conquest of the town of Sinjar, which led to a major humanitarian crisis. The international coalition responded with airdrops of supplies, rescues, and airstrikes against ISIS. The Yazidi population in northern Iraq is estimated to be around 500,000, making up less than 1% of the country's population.

Harry Kane, a Tottenham striker, has had a remarkable season, breaking into the first team and England squad. He is nominated for both PFA Player and Young Player of the Season. A new animation, produced by Copa90, features still photographs of Kane's goals and celebrations, creating an animated effect. The video, titled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?', is released ahead of the awards ceremony where Kane competes with Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez for the top prize.

Jamie Carragher, a former Liverpool defender, believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right man to lead the team forward, despite a disappointing season with no trophies and a likely finish outside the top four. Carragher backed Rodgers after Liverpool's third consecutive season without a trophy, and emphasized that one game should not determine a manager's future. The team is currently seven points behind fourth-placed Manchester City with a game in hand and is unlikely to qualify for the Champions League next season. Carragher suggested that Rodgers, the players, and the staff will focus on improving and identifying areas for improvement in the squad, with the signings playing a crucial role in their success. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside, where he has provided coaching in eight deprived areas through his 23 Foundation. He hopes to inspire youngsters and give them a boost to achieve their goals, as he grew up in an under-privileged area and received help and encouragement from people around him.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his plastic nerf gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport due to it being deemed a security risk. The gun, which fires sponge darts, was detected on the airport's X-ray machines. James's parents, Phil and Hazel, were critical of the security checks, labeling them as over-zealous. They were so late that they had to miss their flight, and James was given a replacement toy gun when they returned from their holiday in Lanzarote. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience and explained that they had offered to send the toy back to the family's home in Doncaster, South Yorkshire. The airport stated that they follow government regulations, which prohibit items that resemble prohibited items, including replica or model guns.

A man named Rich, living in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, has posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife. He has detailed his requirements for his partner, including non-smoker, non-drinker, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, good with hands, good cook, and great in bed. The successful candidate will also enjoy the outdoors and be a 'princess' when needed. Rich, who is 31, is athletic build, white, heavily tattooed, brown hair, brown eyes, does not drink or smoke, and is successful. He loves traveling, outdoors, sports, fishing, and camping. He owns his own property and is looking for a partner who is also well-endowed. He is not shy of spending money on his partner and promises to consider all reasonable offers. Former partners are not considered.

Greg Dyke, FA chairman, seeks to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12, facing opposition from the Premier League. Five former England managers (Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren) support Dyke's proposals, warning that failure to implement them may lead to England falling behind other football nations. Only 36.8% of Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection. The managers emphasize the need for more opportunities for young English talent, citing the rise of players like Harry Kane as a positive sign. Despite some encouraging signs, England still faces challenges in producing top young talent due to the shrinking pool of English players at the top level.

Demelza Poldark, played by Eleanor Tomlinson, has given birth to Aidan Turner's character Ross Poldark's baby daughter in the latest episode of the show. The pregnancy timeline seems to have skipped significant time, with Demelza going from announcing the pregnancy to giving birth in a short span of time. This rapid progression has led to fans comparing it to the show's previous pregnancy timeline, where a character went to full term in a short period. The fast relationship between Ross and Demelza has also caught the attention of fans.

Leicester's manager, Nigel Pearson, has advised the team to concentrate on their own performance and not be influenced by their relegation rivals. After securing back-to-back wins, including a 3-2 victory at West Brom, Leicester is just three points away from safety in the Barclays Premier League. Jamie Vardy's injury-time winner against West Brom Albion further improved their survival chances. Pearson emphasizes the importance of focusing on their own games to secure a realistic chance of survival, as they cannot control other teams' performances. He also warns against overoptimism, as people may adjust their perceptions based on results.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara has set the record for the longest migration of a mammal, traveling nearly 14,000 miles from her primary feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico. This journey surpassed the previous record set by a humpback whale. The long trip suggests that some western gray whales might be eastern grays, as Varvara visited three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales. This finding could impact the estimated population of western gray whales, which is currently at 150.

1,000ft of seabed has surfaced on the east coast of Japan's Hokkaido Island, creating a new stretch of coastline in the Shiretoko Peninsula near the town of Rausu. This sudden change is believed to be due to a landslide caused by melting ice and snow, which pivoted the underwater area into the air. The new landmass, measuring around 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, rose as high as 50ft above sea level. Despite the unexpected appearance, there were no tremors or sounds indicating the land movement overnight. Authorities have not determined the exact time of the landslide but expect it to stop expanding further. The new coastline is home to marine organisms still attached to the landmass.

Gregory van der Wiel, a full-back for Paris Saint-Germain, has denied rumors of leaving the club in the summer. He expressed his love for the club, its city, and his teammates, stating that he is happy and has no intention of leaving. Despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc, van der Wiel is open to signing a new contract. However, the club's interest in Barcelona's Dani Alves could potentially lead to van der Wiel being sold.

Carlos Tevez, the former Manchester City striker, has informed Juventus of his intention to terminate his contract and return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina. The Serie A champions are willing to let him go, but Tevez must first end his contract with Juventus, which runs until 2016. Boca Juniors are close to finalizing a deal for Tevez, who scored 26 league goals in 76 appearances for the club before joining Corinthians in 2005. Juventus are reluctant to lose Tevez, who has netted 17 times this season, but have accepted his desire to leave and are identifying potential replacements. Tevez has always expressed his intention to finish his career at Boca Juniors.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped his trousers leg during the Champions League match against Porto. Despite the incident, Bayern won the match 6-1, securing their place in the semi-finals. Guardiola's former teammates, Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and Robert Lewandowski, scored the goals. Porto, who had a two-goal lead from the first leg, were defeated. Guardiola, who ditched his suit blazer later in the match, joked about needing new trousers for the next game.

Ten people, including four children, were involved in a multi-vehicle crash in Brisbane's west. The crash occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, causing three vehicles to collide. The first patients, a 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy with chest pain, were flown to the Princess Alexandra Hospital. Shortly after, a 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl with abdominal pain were also flown out. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. A man suffered hand lacerations and two females escaped injuries. The affected stretch of the highway has been closed off, with diversions in place south of Fernvale. Emergency crews found one person trapped inside their vehicle and used hydraulic cutting gear to free them. The Rescue 500 helicopt

Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil has received a new Apple Watch as a gift, which he compared to the character Michael Knight's watch from the TV show Knight Rider. The watch is expected to be released on Friday and Ozil is excited about it. Meanwhile, Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere is expected to start for Arsenal against Chelsea, but his fitness is a concern as he has been out for five months due to injury. Wilshere is considered a future star of the club, but his ability to stay fit is a question mark. Arsenal trail Chelsea by 10 points with six league games remaining.

Mark Clattenburg, a leading Premier League referee, will officiate the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City. Despite sending off three United players and one City player this season, Clattenburg has been accused of favoring City. He has only sent off two players in the Premier League this season, both from United. The derby is highly anticipated as both teams are in contention for the title, with United winning their last five games and City struggling since the start of the year. Clattenburg will be assisted by Simon Beck and Jake Collin, and Jonathan Moss will serve as the fourth official.

Bob Katter, an outspoken MP of Lebanese descent, accused the Queensland Government of assuming embattled MP Billy Gordon would resign due to domestic violence accusations and hiding his criminal past. Katter, who has experienced racism from both major parties, used the term 'black puppet on a string' to express his sympathy with Gordon's position. However, the statement sparked criticism on social media, with users questioning the terminology. Katter defended his statement, stating he used the term due to his personal experiences and to highlight racial overtones. He vowed Gordon would not become a puppet for the government.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She has created a video of her dancing to challenge stereotypes about people with disabilities and inspire others. Dayna has faced bullying and stares due to her disability but hopes to change the way people with disabilities are represented in media. She wants to inspire others to think before judging and not define her based on her disability. Dayna has also started doing motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City, an MLS side, is interested in signing Manchester United's Javier Hernandez, who is a popular figure among their Latin-American fanbase. Hernandez, who has one year left on his contract, has been on loan at Real Madrid but has been struggling. Eight European sides, including Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord, are also interested in signing him. Meanwhile, Manchester United has made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old midfielder Andreas Pereira, who has attracted interest from several European clubs, including Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord.

A gang of at least three people set a car on fire at a gas station in South Los Angeles after an argument with the driver. The incident occurred around 12:15am on Saturday, and the driver was pumping gas at a 76 Station. The suspects covered the white Dodge Charger in gasoline and lit it ablaze while there were two passengers inside. The driver and passengers were not injured, but the car was completely destroyed. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson, and the suspects remain at large.

Charles Manuel, a chiropractor from Lamoni, Iowa, has surrendered his state license after being accused of accepting sex as payment for his services, performing exorcisms, and recommending patients stop taking prescribed medication. He admitted to these misdeeds in a monthly agreement and will not apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years. Despite the allegations, Manuel received excellent patient satisfaction ratings on HealthGrades.com, with three positive reviews giving him a perfect five-star rating. His practice was listed as a home address on Yelp, and he has not worked there for some time.

The U.S. complained to Russia about an incident where a Russian SU-27 Flanker intercepted a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance plane in international airspace over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. crew found the Russian pilot's aggressive maneuvers unsafe and unprofessional. Russia's state news agency reported the U.S. plane was flying towards their border with its transponder off, but the U.S. denied this. This is not the first time such an incident has occurred, with a similar incident happening a year ago in the Sea of Okhotsk. The Pentagon and State Department will file a complaint through diplomatic channels with Russia.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a hotel parking lot in Salt Lake City just before President Obama's visit to Utah. The rifle was secured in a hard case and tied to a truck safe with padlocks and chains, but was still stolen by breaking the rear right passenger-side window and using the momentum from another vehicle to break the case's handle free from the lock. The thief also stole the agent's gear bag, backpack, and some clothing and tools. The hotel does not have surveillance cameras, and the rifle's serial number has been entered into the National Crime Information Computer. The Secret Service was notified about the theft before Obama's visit, but could not comment on any security changes. The theft is still under investigation.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of murdering his neighbour, Terrence Freebody, in 2012. Costa allegedly stomped on Freebody's head, cut his throat, and stabbed him multiple times in the dining room of his home in Red Hill, Canberra. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen believes Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the incident. Costa made triple 0 calls during the incident, which suggested his mood fluctuated. The trail of faeces from the crime scene to the toilet was also found, indicating Costa's confused mental state. Professor Mullen believes Costa's brain was compromised by dementia and alcohol, which led to a confused state and a lack of understanding of the consequences of his actions. The prosecutor suggested that Costa feigned his failing memory during interviews, but Professor Mullen denied this. The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa

Everton manager Roberto Martinez defended Ross Barkley after he missed a penalty against Burnley, despite Leighton Baines being the more experienced penalty taker. Barkley's penalty was saved by Burnley goalkeeper Tom Heaton. Martinez insisted Barkley was within his rights to take the penalty, and praised him for showing responsibility in the moment. Everton eventually won the match 1-0 thanks to a goal from Romelu Lukaku.

Two passengers, found dead in a stateroom on the Holland America Line cruise ship ms Ryndam, are believed to have died in a murder-suicide. The incident was reported at 11:30 a.m. on Thursday, and the ship was immediately secured with the authorities, including the FBI, notified. The authorities are investigating and will determine the official cause of death. The ship, which left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 for a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise, is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The cleaning staff on the ship discovered the deceased passengers after knocking on the cabin's door.

Patrick Kluivert, a former Holland forward and assistant coach, made his coaching debut with Curacao in World Cup qualifying. He led Curacao to a 4-3 aggregate win over Montserrat, advancing them to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament. Curacao won 2-1 in the first leg and 2-2 in the second leg, with Charlton Vicento scoring the winning goal in the 87th minute. Curacao will face Cuba in the next round, scheduled for June 8 and 16. Kluivert, whose mother is from Curacao, has previously experience as a World Cup semi-finalist as a player and as assistant coach to Louis van Gaal.

Esteban Cambiasso, a former Inter Milan and Real Madrid player, has won numerous European trophies. He currently manages Leicester City, who are struggling in the Premier League and are seven points adrift at the bottom. Cambiasso is determined to keep Leicester in the league, comparing it to winning a trophy. He has been with Leicester for nine months and is happy with his family situation. Despite not winning a game since January, he remains optimistic about avoiding relegation, with eight games left in the season.

23-year-old Gemma, a mother of two, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children by her 52-year-old mother Debbie due to her substance abuse, particularly legal high MKat, and suspected theft. Gemma is unemployed and has a history of underage drinking and sexual activity. Debbie has been caring for the children since social services threatened to take them away and feels Gemma is not fit to have them. Gemma denies stealing an iPad from one of the children but admits to stealing money and other items from Debbie in the past. Debbie is preparing to ban Gemma from the house and from seeing the children due to her inability to trust her not to steal from them.

Chelsea's John Terry was criticized by pundits for a rough tackle on Manchester United's Radamel Falcao, which led to Chelsea's opening goal. Terry's challenge from behind sent Falcao to the ground, and pundits agreed that play should have been stopped for the foul. Despite Falcao's struggle to hold onto the ball, Terry's challenge was deemed a foul by the pundits.

Lady Antebellum's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway, but all passengers, including singer Hillary Scott, were safely evacuated. The fire started after a rear tire blew out and destroyed the back lounge of the bus, except for Hillary Scott's Bible. The band's other members were not on the bus.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman, a scientist from Dundee University, is developing a space laser system that converts sunlight into energy using mirrors and semi-conductors. The laser beams will be used to boost solar panel energy reception and potentially restore power instantly to disaster-hit areas. Unlike fictional lasers, these will not be powerful enough to harm humans or cause planet-wide destruction. The system is currently being tested in Scotland and is set to move to Portugal. It's different from previous proposals involving lasers on the International Space Station to clear space debris, which would target larger pieces of junk and not be powerful enough to be weaponized. Dr. Quarterman acknowledges the potential control issue with his satellites.

Stephen Munden, a 54-year-old predatory paedophile with a fanatical obsession with young girls, has gone missing from a psychiatric unit near Hook, Hampshire. He was last seen leaving a hospital and is described as about 5ft 8ins tall, of a heavy build, with dark hair. Munden was detained under the Mental Health Act after sexually touching a three-year-old girl on a bus and was last seen leaving the hospital in Winchfield. He is believed to have shaved off his beard before leaving the hospital. Munden was convicted of sexually touching a child under the age of 13 and admitted to possessing or attempting to possess indecent images of children. He is considered a high-risk individual and officers are urgently seeking information to locate him.

V. Stiviano, a former female companion of Donald Sterling, has been ordered by a Los Angeles judge to pay back over $2.6 million in gifts she received from Sterling. This order was made after Sterling's wife, Shelly Sterling, sued Stiviano, accusing her of targeting wealthy older men and that Sterling used the couple's money to buy her luxury cars and a duplex. Stiviano countered that there was nothing wrong with the gifts and that she never took advantage of Sterling. The court decision was welcomed by Shelly Sterling, who considered it a victory for the family. The gifts included not just luxury cars, but also items like a $391 Easter bunny costume and a $12 lace thong. Sterling's downfall came after an audio recording of him making racist remarks to Stiviano was made public. He was banned from the NBA, fined $2.5 million, and his ownership rights in the Clippers franchise were terminated.

Thierry Henry, a former Arsenal player, has criticized the club's recent transfer dealings and urged them to sign four top players in the summer to win the Barclays Premier League title. He believes Arsenal need a goalkeeper, centre back, defensive midfielder, and striker. Henry also criticized Olivier Giroud, stating that Arsenal cannot win the league with him as their top striker. He compared Arsenal's situation to Chelsea's, which won the league after signing Thibaut Courtois, Nemanja Matic, Cesc Fabregas, and Diego Costa. Henry emphasized the need for a competitive spirit within the team to win the league.

A young woman who was abused by Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn for years has told a court about the severe impact it had on her life. Van Ryn pleaded guilty to 12 sex offences, including the most serious charge of persistent sexual abuse of a child. The victim, who cannot be named, said she is scared for her future relationships and has attempted to take her own life since she heard Van Ryn had been caught. She has suffered from depression since she was 14 and has been hospitalized for self-harm and attempted suicide. The hearing continues.

Serge Gnabry, a 19-year-old Arsenal midfielder, has been out for over a year due to a serious knee injury. He last played for the first team in March 2014. However, he recently played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading, indicating he is over his injury worries. Gnabry expressed that he is feeling better and looking forward to the next game.

23-year-old graduate Jacob Phillips fell to his death from a 70ft cliff in Penarth, South Wales, after running from a taxi to avoid paying the fare. He had caught a taxi home after a night out with friends but didn't have enough cash to pay. The cabbie, Dave Sidaway, gave chase but didn't know the danger Phillips faced. Phillips, from Reading, Berks, had been out drinking in Cardiff and had planned to stay at a friend's house but couldn't afford the fare. He and his friends decided to trick the driver by 'dodging' the fare. Phillips ran off into the 'pitch black' and fell down a cliff at the end of the disused Northern Promenade. He was discovered the next day by a dog walker and pronounced dead at the scene. The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death, stating that Phillips likely became disorientated and didn't know the danger he faced.

Thousands of holidaymakers faced passport delays last summer, leading to extra costs and missed trips. Despite the financial strain, the HM Passport Office made a £42.3 million profit during the chaos. Ministers refused to provide blanket refunds to affected families, and only a few hundred compensation claims were approved, totaling £203,066. The Passport Office also rejected a demand for all those left out of pocket to be compensated, citing a potential precedent.

The passage describes a timewarp home in Horfield, Bristol, built in the 1930s and remaining unchanged since then. The property features original elements such as stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, retro jars of food, a vintage cupboard, and the original bathroom and kitchen. The house also has a wood-panelled hallway, original tiles, wooden floor, yellow wallpaper, and a green sink in the dated bathroom. The living room has patterned windows with coats of arms on the glass. The three-bedroom home comes with all the original 1930s cupboards in the kitchen, a brick open-face fire, and a dated kitchen sink. The property has a guide price of between £200,000 and £250,000. Although some features have been upgraded, such as double glazing, the potential cost of renovations may deter developers. The house is expected to be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Colin Kaepernick started as a backup to Alex Smith but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season due to Smith's concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, but lost to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds and Tracey Edmonds, and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice, born in New Orleans, lived in Texas and San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mi freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey, connecting the New Jersey Turnpike to New York State Route 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network owned by Comcast through its NBCUniversal division, NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn, a London native, formed the band Blur in 1989, with their debut album "Leisure" released in 1991. The band's music was influenced by various genres including alternative rock, trip hop, hip hop, electronica, dub, reggae, and pop. Their self-titled debut album was released in 2001 to global success. Albarn later released his debut solo studio album "Everyday Robots" in 2014, co-produced by Richard Russell, featuring collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan, and the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir, and sampling rants by Lord Buckley.
Mogadishu, also known as Hamar, is the capital and largest city of Somalia. It is home to many significant national institutions.
The song "Happiness in Slavery" is from Nine Inch Nails' debut extended play, "Broken," released in 1992.
Andrew Kevin Walker is an American screenwriter who has been BAFTA-nominated.

The film "Shooter" (2007) features Mark Wahlberg as Bob Lee Swagger, a Force Recon veteran wrongfully accused of murder by a rogue private military company. The TV series "Shooter" (not specified year) stars Ryan Phillippe as Bob Lee Swagger, an exiled expert marksman who returns to action after discovering a plot to assassinate the president.
House, also known as House, M.D., is an American medical drama that aired on Fox for eight seasons from 2004 to 2012.

In 1971, Charles Manson was convicted for the murders of seven people, including actress Sharon Tate, and two others, Gary Hinman and Donald "Shorty" Shea. He was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder. His songs were commercially released after his conviction.

Sean Penn is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He started his acting career in television with a brief appearance in Little House on the Prairie in 1974, directed by his father. His film debut was in the drama Taps (1981), followed by a diverse range of film roles in the 1980s, including Fast Times at Ridgemont High (1982). Penn gained critical recognition for his roles in crime dramas like At Close Range (1986), State of Grace (1990), and Carlito's Way (1993). He became a prominent leading actor with Dead Man Walking (1995), earning his first Academy Award nomination and the Best Actor Award at the Berlin Film Festival. Penn received two more Oscar nominations for Woody Allen's Sweet and Lowdown (1999) and the drama I Am Sam (2001), before winning his first Academy Award for Best Actor in

Sir Donald George "Don" Bradman, AC (27 August 1908 - 25 February 2001), known as "The Don," was an Australian cricketer considered the greatest batsman of all time. After retirement, he continued to hold a prominent position in the game as an administrator, selector, and writer for three decades.
L.A. Reid has held leadership positions at Epic Records, Arista Records, and Island Def Jam Music Group, serving as chairman and CEO at each.

Brad Wilk is a drummer, best known for his work with Rage Against the Machine (1991-2000, 2007-11) and Audioslave (2001-07). He started his career as a drummer for Greta in 1990 and co-founded Rage with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in August 1991. As of 2016, he is playing in the band Prophets of Rage with Commerford, Morello, Chuck D, B-Real, and DJ Lord. Rage is a German heavy metal band formed in 1984 by Peter "Peavy" Wagner.

The Millers was a multi-camera series that aired on CBS from 2013 to 2015, consisting of 34 episodes over two seasons. However, due to cancellation, the show only ran for four episodes into its second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards (1933-2006) was an American politician who served as the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat and gained national attention as the state treasurer of Texas in 1988 when she delivered the keynote address at the Democratic National Convention. Richards was the second female governor of Texas, known for her outspoken feminism and memorable one-liners. Ann Richards (1935-1982) was an American jazz singer and the wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Drake Bell released an EP titled "A Reminder" in 2011 independently.

Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film directed by Stephen Verona. Janet Leigh, born Jeanette Helen Morrison, was an American actress, singer, dancer, and author who wrote four books, including two novels, between 1984 and 2002. She passed away on October 3, 2004.

Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Palacios, known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who played a key role in the independence of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama from Spanish rule. He was born on 24 July 1783 and died on 17 December 1830.

The Bermuda Triangle, also known as the Devil's Triangle, is a loosely-defined region in the western North Atlantic Ocean where numerous aircraft and ships have allegedly disappeared under mysterious circumstances.

Colin Kaepernick started his professional career as a backup to Alex Smith but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season due to Smith's concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. In his first full season as a starter in 2013, he helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship but lost to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a marketing communication method using audio or visual content to promote or sell products, services, or ideas. It's non-personal and not directed at an individual, unlike personal selling. Advertising is conveyed through various mass media, including old media like newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, outdoor ads, and direct mail, as well as new media such as search results, blogs, websites, and text messages.
Private Lives is a 1930 comedy of manners play by Noël Coward, adapted into a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.

Maurice Harold Macmillan was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1957 to 1963. He was born on 10 February 1894 and passed away on 29 December 1986.

Aristotle was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist, born in Stagira, Chalkidice. He joined Plato's Academy in Athens at 17-18 and remained until 37. After Plato's death, he tutored Alexander the Great in Macedon.

David Mordechai Packouz is an American former arms dealer, musician, inventor, and entrepreneur. He is known for inventing the BeatBuddy, a guitar pedal drum machine, and currently serves as the CEO of music technology company Singular Sound.

Magic Johnson was a point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons, winning multiple championships including the NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award in his rookie season. He retired and returned twice due to protests from fellow players, and was named one of America's most influential black businessmen in 2009. He also had business interests and was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years.

Tenacious D is an American comedy rock duo formed in Los Angeles in 1994 by Jack Black and Kyle Gass. They have released three albums: Tenacious D (2001), The Pick of Destiny (2006), and Rize of the Fenix (2012). The band gained popularity in 1997 with their television series and supported major rock acts.

James VI and I, born James Stuart on 19 June 1566, was the King of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and the King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until his death on 27 March 1625. He was a major advocate for a single parliament for England and Scotland, achieving most of his aims in Scotland. However, he faced significant challenges in England, including the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and repeated conflicts with the English Parliament. The kingdoms of Scotland and England were individual sovereign states with their own parliaments, judiciary, and laws, though both were ruled by James in personal union.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming eighteenth series of the British reality television show. It is hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley, a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist. Bentley is known for narrating the UK's version of Big Brother since its inception in 2000, and has also done continuity announcements for Channel 4 until 2011. He is one of Britain's most recognised voices due to his voice-over work and Geordie accent.

The Free State of Saxony is a landlocked German state, bordering five other states and two countries. It's the tenth largest state and sixth most populous in Germany, with an area of 18,413 km2 and a population of 4 million. Saxony has a rich history spanning over a millennium and is known for its wine regions, including the Saxony and Saale-Unstrut wine regions, which are the only two German wine regions located in the former East Germany.
East End Park is a former baseball stadium in Cincinnati, Ohio, while "In the End" is a song by the band Linkin Park.
Mel B Brown started her solo career with the release of the song "I Want You Back" in collaboration with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest child of Billy Ray Cyrus, and has two siblings: Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai, featuring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah in lead roles, with a supporting cast including Paresh Rawal, Gulshan Grover, Raza Murad, and Sadashiv Amrapurkar. The film, released on 1st July 1994, became the second highest grossing Indian film of that year and received nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Originally, Divya Bharti was cast for the female lead, but after her death, Raveena Tandon replaced her. The film is also known for its popular songs from that year.
"Hourglass" is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure, and it is also the fourteenth studio album by singer-songwriter James Taylor.

Shane Black is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor, born on December 16, 1961. He gained fame for writing the 1987 action film "Lethal Weapon." His directorial debut was the film "Kiss Kiss Bang Bang" in 2005.
"A View to a Kill (1985) is the 14th James Bond film, marking Roger Moore's seventh and final appearance as the titular MI6 agent, James Bond."
Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, located in western New Guinea. It was previously known as Irian Jaya, and originally included all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus, likely due to natural causes, is believed to have passed away. However, there were unconfirmed speculations that his wife Livia was involved in his death.

Jennifer Lopez entered the music industry in 1999 with her debut album "On the 6" and the hit single "If You Had My Love". She achieved a milestone in 2001 by having a number one album and film release simultaneously with "J.Lo" and "The Wedding Planner". After her second divorce, she had a public relationship with Ben Affleck, which impacted her third album "This Is Me... Then" and the poorly received film "Gigli". Lopez later married Marc Anthony and had twins in 2008. She gained popularity again in 2011 with her role on American Idol and the hit single "On the Floor", which is one of the best-selling singles of all time.
